Installing pipe-node

How to install pipe-node on desktop or server setups, ideal for full nodes or testing applications

There are various installation methods that suit different needs and have varying difficulty.

Install on Docker
Requirements

  • Docker

Steps

  • Download the Docker image from GitHub

  • Run "docker load < pipe-0.2.tar.gz"

  • Run "alias pipe_node='docker run --rm -v $(pwd):/storage -e RUST_LOG=debug -it pipe:0.2'" to get an easy prefix for pipe_node!

    • When a tutorial asks you to open another terminal, make sure this alias is still set or add it to your ~/.bashrc or similar!

  • You're ready to follow any configuration tutorial!

Install from Source
Requirements

  • This tutorial assumes you have Rust or Cargo installed. If you don't, check out https://​rustup​.rs

Steps

  • Clone the PIPE CLI repo: "git clone https://​github​.com​/Tanglehub​/pipe-monorepo"

  • In the terminal, cd to "pipe-node"

  • Run "alias pipe_node='cargo run -- '"

    • When a tutorial asks you to open another terminal, make sure this alias is still set or add it to your ~/.bashrc or similar!

  • You're ready to follow any configuration tutorial!

Post-installation

Run How to run a private PIPE network
